title: Hiding elements in an array in Edge Animate
body:
I have a click function in Edge Animate that needs to hide some elements on a page and then randomly display one of the elements each time it is clicked. I've put the elements in an array.

var myCard = ['Card_1', 'Card_2', 'Card_3', 'Card_4', 'Card_5', 'Card_6', 'Card_7', 'Card_8', 'Card_9', 'Card_10'];

var myCard = document.getElementsByClassName("card");â€‹
for (var i = 0; i < myCard.length; i++) {
myCard[i].style.display = 'none'; 
}

var card = myCard[Math.floor(Math.random() * myCard.length)];
sym.$(card).show();
sym.getSymbol(card).play();

If I hide each element separately it works but if I try and loop through the array to hide the elements it doesn't. The random generator and show/play works fine. What am I doing wrong with the hide function?
